prop.name: photo
prop.desc: A photograph of this place.

prop.name: openingHoursSpecification
prop.desc: The opening hours of a certain place.

prop.name: events
prop.desc: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

prop.name: smokingAllowed
prop.desc: Indicates whether it is allowed to smoke in the place, e.g. in the restaurant, hotel or hotel room.

prop.name: globalLocationNumber
prop.desc: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

prop.name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
prop.desc: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

prop.name: reviews
prop.desc: Review of the item.

prop.name: aggregateRating
prop.desc: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

prop.name: photos
prop.desc: Photographs of this place.

prop.name: map
prop.desc: A URL to a map of the place.

prop.name: branchCode
prop.desc:
A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs.

For example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

prop.name: hasMap
prop.desc: A URL to a map of the place.

prop.name: additionalProperty
prop.desc:
A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.

Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

prop.name: address
prop.desc: Physical address of the item.

prop.name: specialOpeningHoursSpecification
prop.desc:
The special opening hours of a certain place.

Use this to explicitly override general opening hours brought in scope by openingHoursSpecification or openingHours.

prop.name: amenityFeature
prop.desc: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

prop.name: logo
prop.desc: An associated logo.

prop.name: telephone
prop.desc: The telephone number.

prop.name: geo
prop.desc: The geo coordinates of the place.

prop.name: containedInPlace
prop.desc: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

prop.name: review
prop.desc: A review of the item.

prop.name: publicAccess
prop.desc: A flag to signal that the Place is open to public visitors. If this property is omitted there is no assumed default boolean value

prop.name: event
prop.desc: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

prop.name: containsPlace
prop.desc: The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains.

prop.name: isicV4
prop.desc: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

prop.name: maps
prop.desc: A URL to a map of the place.

prop.name: faxNumber
prop.desc: The fax number.

prop.name: isAccessibleForFree
prop.desc: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

prop.name: containedIn
prop.desc: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.desc: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

Thing.name: image
Thing.desc: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: additionalType
Thing.desc: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

Thing.name: identifier
Thing.desc: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

Thing.name: potentialAction
Thing.desc: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

Thing.name: mainEntityOfPage
Thing.desc: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.

Thing.name: disambiguatingDescription
Thing.desc: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
